intro: Croton huamaliensis, commonly known as the Huamaliensis Croton, is a species of flowering plant in the Euphorbiaceae family. It is native to the tropical regions of South America, particularly in Peru and Ecuador. The plant is characterized by its striking, colorful leaves that display a variety of shades, including red, yellow, and green. It typically grows in humid, lowland areas and thrives in partial to full sunlight. Due to its ornamental value, it is sometimes cultivated as a decorative plant in gardens and greenhouses.
